module.name: pygame2.base
module.desc: Base module for pygame2 that contains features shared and used throughout the whole pygame2 package.

class.name: BufferProxy
class.desc:
Creates a new, empty :class:`BufferProxy`.
A buffer interface object that acts as a proxy on classes and attributes not featuring the buffer interface. A :class:`BufferProxy` usually should be constructed from C code, not Python.
class.attr: Gets the size of the buffer data in bytes.
Gets the raw buffer data as string. The string may contain NUL bytes.

method.name: write
method.desc:
Writes raw data to the :class:`BufferProxy`.
Writes the raw data from buffer to the :class:`BufferProxy` object, starting at the specified offset within the :class:`BufferProxy`. If the length of the passed buffer exceeds the length of the :class:`BufferProxy` (reduced by the offset), an :exc:`IndexError` will be raised.

class.name: Color
class.desc:
Creates a new :class:`Color` object.
The :class:`Color` class represents RGBA color values using a value range of 0-255. It allows basic arithmetic operations to create new colors, supports conversions to other color spaces such as HSV or HSL and lets you adjust single color channels. The following constructors are supported:
* Color (0xAARRGGBB) * Color (0xRRGGBB) * Color (r, g, b, a) * Color (r, g, b) * Color ("0xRRGGBBAA") * Color ("#RRGGBBAA") * Color ("name")
class.attr: Gets or sets the alpha value of the :class:`Color`.
Gets or sets the blue value of the :class:`Color`.

The CMY representation of the :class:`Color`. The CMY components are in the ranges C = [0, 1], M = [0, 1], Y = [0, 1]. Note that this will not return the absolutely exact CMY values for the set RGB values in all cases. Due to the RGB mapping from 0-255 and the CMY mapping from 0-1 rounding errors may cause the CMY values to differ slightly from what you might expect.

method.name: correct_gamma
method.desc:
Applies a certain gamma value to the :class:`Color`.
Applies a certain gamma value to the :class:`Color` and returns a new :class:`Color` with the adjusted RGBA values.

class.attr: Gets or sets the green value of the :class:`Color`.

The HSLA representation of the :class:`Color`. The HSLA components are in the ranges H = [0, 360], S = [0, 100], L = [0, 100], A = [0, 100]. Note that this will not return the absolutely exact HSL values for the set RGB values in all cases. Due to the RGB mapping from 0-255 and the HSL mapping from 0-100 and 0-360 rounding errors may cause the HSL values to differ slightly from what you might expect.

The HSVA representation of the :class:`Color`. The HSVA components are in the ranges H = [0, 360], S = [0, 100], V = [0, 100], A = [0, 100]. Note that this will not return the absolutely exact HSV values for the set RGB values in all cases. Due to the RGB mapping from 0-255 and the HSV mapping from 0-100 and 0-360 rounding errors may cause the HSV values todiffer slightly from what you might expect.

The I1I2I3 representation of the :class:`Color`. The I1I2I3 components are in the ranges I1 = [0, 1], I2 = [-0.5, 0.5], I3 = [-0.5, 0.5]. Note that this will not return the absolutely exact I1I2I3 values for the set RGB values in all cases. Due to the RGB mapping from 0-255 and the I1I2I3 from 0-1 rounding errors may cause the I1I2I3 values to differ slightly from what you might expect.

method.name: normalize
method.desc:
Returns the normalized RGBA values of the :class:`Color`.
Returns the normalized RGBA values of the :class:`Color` as floating point values.

class.attr: Gets or sets the red value of the :class:`Color`.

class.name: Error
class.desc: A specialized exception class that indicates a misbehaviour within the pygame2 modules.

class.name: FRect
class.desc:
A class for storing rectangular coordinates.
A :class:`FRect` is used to store and manipulate rectangular coordinates. TODO
class.attr: Gets or sets the bottom edge position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the bottom left corner position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the bottom right corner position of the :class:`FRect`.

method.name: ceil
method.desc:
Creates a :class:`Rect` from the specified :class:`FRect`.
This creates a :class:`Rect` using the smallest integral values greater or equal to the :class:`FRect` floating point values.

class.attr: Gets or sets the center position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the horizontal center position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the vertical center position of the :class:`FRect`.

method.name: clamp
method.desc:
Moves the rectangle inside another.
Returns a new rectangle that is moved to be completely inside the argument :class:`FRect`. If the rectangle is too large to fit inside, it is centered inside the argument :class:`FRect`, but its size is not changed.

method.name: clamp_ip
method.desc:
Moves the rectangle inside another, in place.
Same as FRect.clamp(FRect), but operates in place.

method.name: clip
method.desc:
Crops a rectangle inside another.
Returns a new rectangle that is cropped to be completely inside the argument :class:`FRect`. If the two rectangles do not overlap to begin with, a :class:`FRect` with 0 size is returned. Thus it returns the area, in which both rects overlap.

method.name: collidedict
method.desc:
Test if one rectangle in a dictionary intersects.
Returns the key and value of the first dictionary value that collides with the :class:`FRect`. If no collisions are found, None is returned. They keys of the passed dict must be :class:`FRect` objects.

method.name: collidedictall
method.desc:
Test if all rectangles in a dictionary intersect.
Returns a list of all the key and value pairs that intersect with the :class:`FRect`. If no collisions are found an empty list is returned. They keys of the passed dict must be :class:`FRect` objects.

method.name: collidelist
method.desc:
Test if one rectangle in a list intersects.
Test whether the rectangle collides with any in a sequence of rectangles. The index of the first collision found is returned. If no collisions are found an index of -1 is returned.

method.name: collidelistall
method.desc:
Test if all rectangles in a list intersect.
Returns a list of all the indices that contain rectangles that collide with the :class:`FRect`. If no intersecting rectangles are found, an empty list is returned.

method.name: collidepoint
method.desc:
Test if a point is inside a rectangle.
Returns true if the given point is inside the rectangle. A point along the right or bottom edge is not considered to be inside the rectangle.

method.name: colliderect
method.desc:
Test if two rectangles overlap.
Returns true if any portion of either rectangle overlap (except the top+bottom or left+right edges).

method.name: contains
method.desc:
Test if one rectangle is inside another.
Returns true when the argument rectangle is completely inside the :class:`FRect`.

method.name: copy
method.desc:
Creates a copy of the :class:`FRect`.
Returns a new :class:`FRect`, that contains the same values as the caller.

method.name: fit
method.desc:
Resize and move a rectangle with aspect ratio.
Returns a new rectangle that is moved and resized to fit another. The aspect ratio of the original :class:`FRect` is preserved, so the new rectangle may be smaller than the target in either width or height.

method.name: floor
method.desc:
Creates a :class:`Rect` from the specified :class:`FRect`.
This creates a :class:`Rect` using the largest integral values less than or equal to the :class:`FRect` floating point values.

class.attr: Gets or sets the height of the :class:`FRect`.

method.name: inflate
method.desc:
Grow or shrink the rectangle size.
Returns a new rectangle with the size changed by the given offset. The rectangle remains centered around its current center. Negative values will shrink the rectangle.

method.name: inflate_ip
method.desc:
Grow or shrink the rectangle size, in place.
Same as FRect.inflate(x, y), but operates in place.

class.attr: Gets or sets the left edge position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the mid bottom edge position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the mid left edge position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the mid right edge position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the mid top edge position of the :class:`FRect`.

method.name: move
method.desc:
Moves the rectangle.
Returns a new rectangle that is moved by the given offset. The x and y arguments can be any integer value, positive or negative.

method.name: move_ip
method.desc:
Moves the rectangle, in place.
Same as FRect.move (x, y), but operates in place.

class.attr: Gets or sets the right position of the :class:`FRect`.

method.name: round
method.desc:
Creates a :class:`Rect` from the specified :class:`FRect`.
This creates a :class:`Rect` using the :class:`FRect` floating point values rounded to the nearest integral value.

class.attr: Gets or sets the width and height of the :class:`FRect` as 2-value tuple.
Gets or sets the top edge position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the top left corner position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the top right corner position of the :class:`FRect`.

method.name: trunc
method.desc:
Creates a :class:`Rect` from the specified :class:`FRect`.
This creates a :class:`Rect` using truncated integral values from the :class:`FRect` floating point values.

method.name: union
method.desc:
Joins two rectangles into one.
Returns a new rectangle that completely covers the area of the two provided rectangles. There may be area inside the new :class:`FRect` that is not covered by the originals.

method.name: union_ip
method.desc:
Joins two rectangles into one, in place.
Same as FRect.union(FRect), but operates in place.

class.attr: Gets or sets the width of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the horizontal top left position of the :class:`FRect`.
Gets or sets the vertical top left position of the :class:`FRect`.

class.name: Surface
class.desc:
An abstract base class for arbitrary :class:`Surface` objects.
You should not instantiate this class directly.

method.name: blit
method.desc:
Performs a blit operation on the :class:`Surface`.
The behaviour, arguments and return value depend on the concrete :class:`Surface` implementation.

method.name: copy
method.desc: Creates a copy of this :class:`Surface`.

class.attr: Gets the height of the :class:`Surface`.
Gets a buffer with the pixels of the :class:`Surface`.
Gets the width and height of the :class:`Surface`.
Gets the width of the :class:`Surface`.
